Bash(".venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import subprocess
import json

# Get repo info
result = subprocess.run\([''git'', ''remote'', ''get-url'', ''origin''], capture_output=True, text=True\)
repo_url = result.stdout.strip\(\)
# Extract owner/repo from URL
parts = repo_url.split\(''/''\)
owner = parts[-2]
repo = parts[-1].replace\(''.git'', ''''\)

print\(f''Repository: {owner}/{repo}''\)
print\(''\\nRecent workflow runs:''\)

# Use curl to get workflow runs \(this won''t work without auth token\)
# For now, just check if we can see the info
print\(f''GitHub: https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}/actions''\)
")

# Find all tests that use patch with socrates.create_orchestrator
import re

with open\(''socrates-cli/tests/test_cli.py'', ''r''\) as f:
    content = f.read\(\)

# Find all @patch decorators with socrates

")

Bash(".venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys, json, datetime
data = json.load\(sys.stdin\)
print\(''=== LATEST WORKFLOW RUNS ===''\)
for run in data.get\(''workflow_runs'', []\)[:5]:
    print\(f""\\n[{run[''run_number'']}] {run[''name'']}""\)
    print\(f""  Status: {run[''status'']} | Conclusion: {run.get\(''conclusion'', ''pending''\)}""\)
    created = datetime.datetime.fromisoformat\(run[''created_at''].replace\(''Z'', ''+00:00''\)\)
    updated = datetime.datetime.fromisoformat\(run[''updated_at''].replace\(''Z'', ''+00:00''\)\)
    elapsed = int\(\(updated - created\).total_seconds\(\) / 60\)
    print\(f""  Duration: {elapsed}m""\)
")

Bash(".venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys, json, datetime
data = json.load\(sys.stdin\)
print\(''=== WORKFLOW STATUS ===''\)
for run in data.get\(''workflow_runs'', []\)[:10]:
    status = run[''status'']
    conclusion = run.get\(''conclusion'', ''pending''\)
    created = datetime.datetime.fromisoformat\(run[''created_at''].replace\(''Z'', ''+00:00''\)\)
    updated = datetime.datetime.fromisoformat\(run[''updated_at''].replace\(''Z'', ''+00:00''\)\)
    elapsed = int\(\(updated - created\).total_seconds\(\) / 60\)
    result = ''[OK]'' if conclusion == ''success'' else ''[FAIL]'' if conclusion == ''failure'' else ''[RUN]''
    print\(f""{result} [{run[''run_number'']}] {run[''name'']}: {status} \({elapsed}m\) - {conclusion}""\)
")

Bash(".venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sqlite3
import tempfile
import os
from socratic_system.database.project_db import ProjectDatabase

# Create a test database to see schema
with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile\(suffix=''.db'', delete=False\) as f:
    db_path = f.name

db = ProjectDatabase\(db_path\)

# Check behavior_patterns table schema
conn = sqlite3.connect\(db_path\)
cursor = conn.cursor\(\)
cursor.execute\(''PRAGMA table_info\(behavior_patterns\)''\)
columns = cursor.fetchall\(\)
conn.close\(\)

print\(''behavior_patterns table columns:''\)
for col in columns:
    print\(f''  {col[1]} \({col[2]}\)''\)

os.remove\(db_path\)
")

Bash(".venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
import os
sys.path.insert\(0, ''socrates-api/src''\)

# Import the routers to check their structure
from socrates_api.routers import auth, notes, analysis

import inspect

print\(''=''*70\)
print\(''ROUTER CODE COVERAGE ANALYSIS''\)
print\(''=''*70\)

# Count functions in each router
for name, module in [\(''auth'', auth\), \(''notes'', notes\), \(''analysis'', analysis\)]:
    functions = [f for f in dir\(module\) if callable\(getattr\(module, f\)\) and not f.startswith\(''_''\)]
    # Filter to endpoint functions \(decorated routes\)
    endpoints = [f for f in functions if hasattr\(getattr\(module, f\), ''__wrapped__''\)]
    
    # Get route info
    routes = [attr for attr in dir\(module.router\) if not attr.startswith\(''_''\)]
    
    print\(f''\\n{name.upper\(\)} Router:''\)
    print\(f''  Module functions: {len\(functions\)}''\)
    print\(f''  Route endpoints: {len\([f for f in inspect.signature\(module.router.post\).parameters]\)}''\)
    
print\(''\\n'' + ''=''*70\)
")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
docs: Comprehensive documentation and branding updates for v1.1.0

Major updates across documentation, examples, and codebase to ensure consistency
with current version \(1.1.0\) and branding \(Socrates AI\) while updating to latest
Claude models.

Documentation Updates:
- Updated all "Socratic RAG System" references to "Socrates AI" \(45 replacements\)
- Updated version references from v7.0 to v1.1.0 across all documentation
- Updated Claude model references from opus-4-1 to opus-4-5-20251101
- Fixed README citation and metadata
- Updated INSTALLATION.md startup banner example output
- Updated DEVELOPER_GUIDE.md to reference new TESTING.md

New Documentation:
- Created comprehensive TESTING.md guide \(661 lines\)
  - Test isolation principles and core rules
  - Database testing patterns with fixtures
  - Vector database testing
  - Configuration isolation examples
  - 4 detailed common testing patterns
  - 5 anti-patterns to avoid with warnings
  - Troubleshooting guide
  - Best practices summary

Code Changes:
- Updated module docstrings across 37 files with correct branding
- Updated requirements.txt header comment
- Updated all internal references to use "Socrates AI"

Files Modified:
- Documentation: 11 files \(README, INSTALLATION, USER_GUIDE, API_REFERENCE, etc.\)
- Examples: 1 file \(QUICKSTART.md\)
- Core Code: 37 files \(agents, models, orchestration, database, etc.\)
- Tests: 2 files \(conftest.py updates\)
- Configuration: 3 files \(knowledge_base.json, etc.\)

Benefits:
- All documentation now consistent with actual version and branding
- Users see correct Claude model recommendations
- New comprehensive testing guide helps developers maintain quality
- All examples use current API and model versions

Generated with Claude Code
Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: Prevent repeated questions in Socratic questioning workflow

Fixed bug where SocraticCounselorAgent would repeatedly ask the same question
instead of progressing through discovery. The issue was that Claude couldn''t
see previously asked questions since they weren''t included in the prompt.

Changes:
- Extract ALL previously asked questions from conversation history for current phase
- Display last 5 questions explicitly in Claude prompt with "DO NOT REPEAT THESE"
- Add explicit instruction to Claude to generate novel questions
- Add guidance to "Push the conversation forward by exploring new aspects"

The system now:
1. Tracks full conversation history including all questions per phase
2. Shows previously asked questions to Claude to prevent repetition
3. Explicitly instructs Claude to avoid rephrasing or repeating questions
4. Continues to leverage knowledge base and previous answers for context

This ensures the Socratic questioning workflow progresses naturally through
the discovery -> analysis -> design -> implementation phases without getting
stuck on the same question.

Generated with Claude Code
Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
